body.p: The previous version of IAS 36 required goodwill to be tested for impairment as part of impairment testing the cash‑generating units to which it relates. It employed a ‘bottom‑up/top‑down’ approach under which the goodwill was in effect tested for impairment by allocating its carrying amount to each of the smallest cash‑generating units to which a portion of that carrying amount could be allocated on a reasonable and consistent basis.
